content:
• Monday, August 6, 2012
  • PVH

    More on Warnaco Group (WRC): Q2 earnings come in mixed, beating on the bottom line but missing...

    More on Warnaco Group (WRC): Q2 earnings come in mixed, beating on the bottom line but missing on top line results. Net earnings plunged 79% Y/Y, weighed down by debt charges tied to the sale of its Lejaby lingerie brand, plus challenging market conditions - particularly in the U.S. and Europe - and adverse currency impact. The company also cut its full-year outlook, lowering the top end of its EPS to a range of $4 to $4.15 on net revenue of down 2% to flat. Shares -1.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:22 PM
  • SNHY

    Sun Hydraulics (NASDAQ:SNHY): Q2 EPS of $0.43 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $57M (+4% Y/Y) beats by...

    Sun Hydraulics (NASDAQ:SNHY): Q2 EPS of $0.43 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $57M (+4% Y/Y) beats by $1M. Shares -10.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • GDP

    Goodrich Petroleum (NYSEMKT:GDP): Q2 EPS of -$0.21 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $41.3M (-21.9%...

    Goodrich Petroleum (NYSEMKT:GDP): Q2 EPS of -$0.21 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $41.3M (-21.9% Y/Y) misses by $21M. Shares -1.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:11 PM
  • ELN

    Elan ELN, which has a 25% ownership stake in Pfizer (NYSE:PFE) and Johnson & Johnson's...

    Elan ELN, which has a 25% ownership stake in Pfizer (NYSE:PFE) and Johnson & Johnson's failed bapineuzumab project, is also trading down after hours, along with Eli Lilly (NYSE:LLY), who has a similar Alzheimer's candidate, solanezumab, for which clinical results are expected in coming weeks. ELN -8.7%, LLY -2.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:55 PM
  • CBOU

    Though Caribou Coffee's (NASDAQ:CBOU) Q2 EPS beat estimates, the company is guiding for 2012...

    Though Caribou Coffee's (NASDAQ:CBOU) Q2 EPS beat estimates, the company is guiding for 2012 sales to be flat (consensus is for 6.9% growth) and EPS to come in at $0.43-$0.46, below a $0.49 consensus. Caribou blames weak sales of K-Cups (NASDAQ:GMCR), due to a mixture of channel shifting, new pricing tiers, and "the loss of a significant account." CBOU now -5.9% AH. GMCR -0.8%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM
  • JNJ

    Johnson & Johnson (NYSE:JNJ) down 1.6% and Pfizer (NYSE:PFE) down 2.1% AH as the companies...

    Johnson & Johnson (NYSE:JNJ) down 1.6% and Pfizer (NYSE:PFE) down 2.1% AH as the companies put a halt on studies of Alzheimer's drug bapineuzumab, which they were developing together but which left execs "disappointed."
     
     
     
     
    | 5:33 PM
  • MDR

    More on McDermott (NYSE:MDR): Q2 is largely in line, with only a slight miss on the top line....

    More on McDermott (NYSE:MDR): Q2 is largely in line, with only a slight miss on the top line. Net earnings fell 22% Y/Y due to a 5.6% jump in total expenses, and spite of a 21% decline in general overhead costs. One bright spot comes from improved performances in its Middle East and Atlantic segments and a better backlog, which stood at $5.7B at the end of June, up from $4.7B a year earlier. Shares -3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM
  • LOPE

    Grand Canyon Education (NASDAQ:LOPE): Q2 EPS of $0.39 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $119.3M (+15.7%...

    Grand Canyon Education (NASDAQ:LOPE): Q2 EPS of $0.39 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $119.3M (+15.7% Y/Y). Shares +16.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:18 PM
  • MDR

    McDermott International (NYSE:MDR): Q2 EPS of $0.22 in-line. Revenue of $889M (+4.6% Y/Y) misses...

    McDermott International (NYSE:MDR): Q2 EPS of $0.22 in-line. Revenue of $889M (+4.6% Y/Y) misses by $4M. Shares -3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM
  • T

    More on Leap Wireless' Q2: The carrier had a net loss of 289K subscribers (205K voice, 84K...

    More on Leap Wireless' Q2: The carrier had a net loss of 289K subscribers (205K voice, 84K broadband), a reversal from Q1's 258K net adds. Churn soared to 4.4% from Q1's 3.3%, and service revenue growth decelerated to 6.7% from a prior 14.1%. Cost per gross add (a concern going in) rose $68 Q/Q to $296, and ARPU fell $0.95 to $41.64. LEAP -12.1% AH. Rival MetroPCS (PCS), which posted a somewhat better Q2 report, could also be under pressure tomorrow. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM
  • GEOY

    GeoEye (NASDAQ:GEOY): Q2 EPS of $0.57 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $88.4M (+1% Y/Y) misses by $1M....

    GeoEye (NASDAQ:GEOY): Q2 EPS of $0.57 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $88.4M (+1% Y/Y) misses by $1M. Shares -2.3% AH. (PR)

    China New Borun (NYSE:BORN): Q2 EPS of $2.65 beats by $0.17. Revenue of $127M (+10.9% Y/Y) beats...

    China New Borun (NYSE:BORN): Q2 EPS of $2.65 beats by $0.17. Revenue of $127M (+10.9% Y/Y) beats by $10M. (PR)

  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK): Q2 EPS of $0.06 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $3.39B (+2.1% Y/Y)...

    Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK): Q2 EPS of $0.06 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $3.39B (+2.1% Y/Y) beats by $7M. Daily production averaged 3.808 bcfe, +25% Y/Y and +4% Q/Q. Shares +3.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM | 6 Comments
  • ESL

    Esterline (NYSE:ESL) releases its preliminary Q3 results, saying it expects to record a $52M...

    Esterline (NYSE:ESL) releases its preliminary Q3 results, saying it expects to record a $52M impairment charge against goodwill for its Racal Acoustics defense business. The charge will impact Q3 EPS by $1.67 per share. Other transitory issues are also expected to impact earnings. It now sees FY12 EPS coming in between $4.87 - $5.00, below Street estimates of $5.16. Q4 is also expected to be below consensus at $1.60 - $1.70 per share versus the $1.70 Wall Street estimated. Shares -2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • CSCO

    BroadSoft (BSFT): Q2 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.12. Revenue of $40.5M (+26% Y/Y) beats by $3.2M....

    BroadSoft (BSFT): Q2 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.12. Revenue of $40.5M (+26% Y/Y) beats by $3.2M. Expects Q3 revenue of $40M-$42M and EPS of $0.27-$0.33 vs. consensus of $39.9M and $0.31. Expects 2012 revenue of $162M-$167M and EPS of $1.30-$1.40, above consensus of $161M and $1.25. Company is acquiring Adaption Technologies, a provider of hosted VoIP services. Shares +14% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • HALO

    Halozyme Therapeutics (NASDAQ:HALO): Q2 EPS of -$0.13 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $7.8M (-66.4%...

    Halozyme Therapeutics (NASDAQ:HALO): Q2 EPS of -$0.13 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $7.8M (-66.4% Y/Y) beats by $2.2M. Shares +1.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM

    Durect (NASDAQ:DRRX): Q2 EPS of $0.05 in-line. Revenue of $4.8M misses by $1M. Shares +1.6% AH. (PR)

    Caribou Coffee (NASDAQ:CBOU): Q2 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $81M (+1.1% Y/Y) misses...

  • EXEL

    Shares of Exelixis (EXEL -13%) were hammered today after the biotech firm announced plans to...

    Shares of Exelixis (EXEL -13%) were hammered today after the biotech firm announced plans to hold back-to-back public offerings. It plans to offer, subject to market conditions, 20M common shares and an aggregate $225M of convertible senior subordinated notes due in 2019.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • AES

    AES Corp. (AES -4.5%) shares languish after Q2 earnings at the power and utilities company...

    AES Corp. (AES -4.5%) shares languish after Q2 earnings at the power and utilities company tumbled 20% with a double-digit decline in revenue from its key Latin American utilities business. AES says it expects EPS for the year to come in at the low end of its May guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • DDC

    Harry Winston (HWD +2.2%) has secured bank financing for a potential deal to buy the Ekati...

    Harry Winston (HWD +2.2%) has secured bank financing for a potential deal to buy the Ekati diamond mine from BHP Billiton (BHP +0.7%), but the sale process has moved slowly and may still break down, FT reports. Complicating things is Rio Tinto's (NYSE:RIO) nearby mine it may want to sell; HWD owns a 40% stake and may decide to pick up the remaining 60%, but it can't afford to do both deals.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM
  • BBY

    S&P cuts its rating on Best Buy (BBY +15.1%) to BB+ from BBB-, saying a buyout led by founder...

    S&P cuts its rating on Best Buy (BBY +15.1%) to BB+ from BBB-, saying a buyout led by founder Richard Schulze would "materially weaken" the company with the substantial amount of debt it would add to the retailer's balance sheet. The ratings agency says depending upon the nature of a finalized buyout, it could lower its ratings by several more notches.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM | 11 Comments
  • HCA

    Hospital stocks recover some, but not all, of today's losses on the back of Health Care...

    Hospital stocks recover some, but not all, of today's losses on the back of Health Care Associates' (HCA -4.3%) earlier drubbing: Health Management (HMA -0.8%), Tenet (THC -1%) and Community Health (CYH -0.8%).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • AVP

    Shares of Avon Products (AVP +4.2%) show strength off of chatter that a white knight buyer may...

    Shares of Avon Products (AVP +4.2%) show strength off of chatter that a white knight buyer may step in with a $24 offer for the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • NAV

    Shares of Navistar (NAV +7.3%) have managed to claw back most of last week's big losses...

    Shares of Navistar (NAV +7.3%) have managed to claw back most of last week's big losses following its disclosure that it was going to log a big Q3 loss and suspend guidance while it digs out from its disastrous engine strategy. More interesting is that today's upside swing comes in the face of a downgrade by Fitch, and comments by the company that it's considering a round of job cuts to save costs.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • CPRI

    Luxury retail stocks trade higher after Prada rides strong Asian growth to post a solid jump in...

    Luxury retail stocks trade higher after Prada rides strong Asian growth to post a solid jump in first-half revenue. Asian demand from high-end spenders is crucial for the sector, often leading to peers swinging up and down together. Gainers: KORS +4.7%, RL +3.2%, COH +3.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • MNK

    Questcor (QCOR +8.3%) gets a bump up from an upgrade to Buy at Suntrust this morning. The firm...

    Questcor (QCOR +8.3%) gets a bump up from an upgrade to Buy at Suntrust this morning. The firm notes that revenue from its nephrotic syndrome treatment is running far better than expected, and with new additions to its sales team it should easily Street script estimates.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM | 2 Comments
  • FB

    Facebook (FB +2.7%) is adding to Friday's gains, though shares remain down 19% from pre-earnings...

    Facebook (FB +2.7%) is adding to Friday's gains, though shares remain down 19% from pre-earnings levels. The company's lock-up expiration begins on Aug. 15 (10% of outstanding shares), and additional releases arrive on Oct. 14 (9%) and Nov. 13 (49%). As Henry Blodget notes, Facebook's selloff will make it tough for the company to pitch a secondary offering to limit volatility, and could also prevent it from paying a $2.5B-$3B tax bill related to restricted stock by selling some of the shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM | 3 Comments
  • SHPG

    Shares of ViroPharm (VPHM) resume trading, currently at $22.80 +14.7%.

    Shares of ViroPharm (VPHM) resume trading, currently at $22.80 +14.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • AKS

    AK Steel (AKS +7.7%) says it will increase current spot market base prices for all carbon...

    AK Steel (AKS +7.7%) says it will increase current spot market base prices for all carbon flat-rolled steel products by $30/ton, effective immediately with new orders. Other steel names power higher: X +6.9%, NUE +2.1%, STLD +3.6%, MT +3.6%, ATI +3.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • RCPI

    Shares of Star Scientific (CIGX +10.3%) run up a double-digit gain, helped in part by word that...

    Shares of Star Scientific (CIGX +10.3%) run up a double-digit gain, helped in part by word that the company will begin trading under the symbol STSI on August 7th to better reflect its focus away from tobacco stocks to dietary supplements.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • NURO

    NeuroMetrix (NURO +17%) jumps after announcing it's received FDA clearance to market its Sensus...

    NeuroMetrix (NURO +17%) jumps after announcing it's received FDA clearance to market its Sensus Pain Management device in the U.S. market. The device is intended for use as a transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulator for the symptomatic relief and management of chronic intractable pain.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM
  • YOKU

    Chinese Internet stocks surge in response to pleasing Q2 reports (I, II, III) from Youku (YOKU...

    Chinese Internet stocks surge in response to pleasing Q2 reports (I, II, III) from Youku (YOKU +7.6%), Sohu (SOHU +17%), and Changyou (CYOU +16.6%). BIDU +4.3%. SINA +9.7%. RENN +11.4%. PWRD +6.7%. TUDO +8%. Baidu's gains are coming in spite of the company's disclosure that 3 employees were arrested for taking bribes to delete message board posts.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM | 3 Comments
  • EMR

    Shares of Emerson Electric (EMR +1.4%) continue to move up ahead of its earnings announcement...

    Shares of Emerson Electric (EMR +1.4%) continue to move up ahead of its earnings announcement tomorrow, gathering a bit of additional steam after crossing over its 200-day moving average , a key technical level. The stocks had a good run recently, having gained nearly 15% since mid July.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • MEDW

    Mediware (MEDW +2.3%) gains after announcing it's acquired the assets of Indianapolis-based...

    Mediware (MEDW +2.3%) gains after announcing it's acquired the assets of Indianapolis-based Strategic Healthcare Group, a provider of blood management consulting, education and informatics solutions. Mediware expects to close on the transaction within 60 days and plans to maintain the Strategic Healthcare Group brand.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM
  • AMD

    AMD (AMD -3.2%) slumps after announcing a $300M debt offering. The struggling chipmaker says it...

    AMD (AMD -3.2%) slumps after announcing a $300M debt offering. The struggling chipmaker says it could use the proceeds to pay down existing debt yielding 5.75% and 6%, to make cash payments to manufacturing partner Globalfoundries, or to make "strategic transactions." S&P has given the debt a BB- rating, and has revised its outlook on AMD to negative from stable in response. AMD had $2.02B in debt on its balance sheet as of June 30.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM | 3 Comments
  • SNP

    Sinopec (SNP +3.2%) and ENN Energy (OTCPK:XNGSF) extend their $2.2B bid for China Gas by...

    Sinopec (SNP +3.2%) and ENN Energy (OTCPK:XNGSF) extend their $2.2B bid for China Gas by another month, as they seek regulatory approvals to proceed with Hong Kong's first unsolicited takeover attempt. But it may turn out that the government is waiting for a higher offer, and those pesky regulations might just fade away.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • CRY

    CryoLife (CRY -3%) slides after Benchmark cut the shares to hold this morning, citing delays in...

    CryoLife (CRY -3%) slides after Benchmark cut the shares to hold this morning, citing delays in the clinical trial of PerClot and the impact that lower R&D spending in the current year is going to have on future earnings performance.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • KOS

    Kosmos Energy (KOS +6.4%) reports a smaller than expected Q2 loss of $0.07/share vs. analyst...

    Kosmos Energy (KOS +6.4%) reports a smaller than expected Q2 loss of $0.07/share vs. analyst consensus of a $0.09 loss and a $0.03 loss a year ago. Revenue declined 11% Y/Y to $112.7M vs. expectations of $113.5M. KOS says it has significantly improved the productivity of five wells that are part of the Jubilee field off the coast of Ghana.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • TPR

    Shares of Coach (COH +4.4%) jump higher to take back more ground lost after the retailer's weak...

    Shares of Coach (COH +4.4%) jump higher to take back more ground lost after the retailer's weak Q2 report. A positive article in Barron's citing the company's strong management and potential to turn around is helping to lift sentiment.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • RAIL

    FreightCar America (RAIL -10.6%) shares slump after the manufacturer of aluminum-bodied railcars...

    FreightCar America (RAIL -10.6%) shares slump after the manufacturer of aluminum-bodied railcars says in its Q2 earnings report that “coal demand remained under pressure from low natural gas prices, high coal inventories and reduced industrial activity.” Orders for new railcars slowed to 967 from 1,244 in Q1 and from 1,089 in the year-ago quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • BSPM

    Health supplement product manufacturer Biostar Pharmaceuticals (OTC:BSPM +18%) gets a big boost...

    Health supplement product manufacturer Biostar Pharmaceuticals (OTC:BSPM +18%) gets a big boost today, after its announcement late Friday it had received "green-light" approval from the Chinese State Food and Drug Administration authorities to restart sales of its gel capsule products.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • TESO

    Tesco Energy (TESO -14.5%) shares drop sharply after the company's disappointing Q2 results....

    Tesco Energy (TESO -14.5%) shares drop sharply after the company's disappointing Q2 results. Tesco's $13.1M in net income included a $13.3M pre-tax gain on the sale of its Casing Drilling business. Revenues grew to $136.7M from $117.3M in the prior-year quarter, but analysts expected revenues of ~10% more.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • NUAN

    Nuance (NUAN +4.5%) jumps after introducing Nina, a virtual assistant solution for iOS and...

    Nuance (NUAN +4.5%) jumps after introducing Nina, a virtual assistant solution for iOS and Android customer support apps. Nina uses a combo of Nuance's voice recognition (VR), text-to-speech, and voice ID tech, and has already picked up financial services firm USAA as a customer. Nuance has been quickly fleshing out its mobile portfolio: other solutions include Swype, Vlingo, a developer program for its Dragon VR software, and the VR tech behind Apple's Siri.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • MATN

    Oxigene (OXGN +17.5%) pops after saying its randomized Phase 2 study evaluating the combination...

    Oxigene (OXGN +17.5%) pops after saying its randomized Phase 2 study evaluating the combination of zybrestat and bevacizumab to treat patients with advanced ovarian cancer achieved important safety objectives in a scheduled interim toxicity analysis, and it's expected to continue to full enrollment.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • HCA

    HCA Holdings (HCA -6%) trades lower despite an overall upbeat Q2 earnings report this morning on...

    HCA Holdings (HCA -6%) trades lower despite an overall upbeat Q2 earnings report this morning on the back of a negative story from the New York Times about its cardiology practices Florida, and the disclosure during its conference call that it's been contacted by the U.S. Attorney's office over the matter.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • BBY

    Shares of Best Buy (BBY +15.5%) settle back a bit from earlier highs as the company confirms...

    Shares of Best Buy (BBY +15.5%) settle back a bit from earlier highs as the company confirms receiving an offer from Richard Schulze to buy out shareholders at $24-$26 a share. The Best Buy founder will need to raise $1B-$2B from P-E firms and $7B-$8B in debt to make a deal fly, according to BB&T Capital Markets.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • KOG

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (KOG +2.9%) is raised to Accumulate from Neutral with a new $13 target...

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (KOG +2.9%) is raised to Accumulate from Neutral with a new $13 target price, up from $10, by Global Hunter, which cites better than expected Q2 results and improved production results. The firm now sees H2 shaping up to at least meet its expectations, setting the table for a potential blockbuster 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 4 Comments
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG +10.9%) jumps on a report AOL has agreed to settle part of Vringo's patent suit...

    Vringo (VRNG +10.9%) jumps on a report AOL has agreed to settle part of Vringo's patent suit against the company. Vringo's suit also targets Google and other Internet companies.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM | 2 Comments
  • PBR

    Petrobras (PBR -2.3%) shares slide after its $665M quarterly loss, but at least two analysts...

    Petrobras (PBR -2.3%) shares slide after its $665M quarterly loss, but at least two analysts still seem positive. The quarter was particularly hurt by a huge non-cash exploratory expense (R$4.3B vs. R$1.2B estimate); excluding such effect, Citigroup says both EBITDA and earnings would have been in-line.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • SN

    Sanchez Energy (SN +5.2%) reports its latest operations update: SN has five wells drilled, cased...

    Sanchez Energy (SN +5.2%) reports its latest operations update: SN has five wells drilled, cased and waiting on completion; its Mark & Sandra #2H well was brought on line in late July with an initial daily production rate of 931 boe/day; and 3D seismic in the Palmetto area has been acquired and processed.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • SIRI

    Sirius XM Radio (SIRI +1.5%) gains after monthly subscriber data from Pandora tips off that...

    Sirius XM Radio (SIRI +1.5%) gains after monthly subscriber data from Pandora tips off that Sirius may be losing less subscribers to Pandora or even picking some back up. Shares of SIRI have held above the $2 mark for over a month and hit a three-month high of $2.20 in intra-day trading.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM | 1 Comment
  • INT

    World Fuel Services (INT +2.7%) agrees to acquire select assets of CarterEnergy, including the...

    World Fuel Services (INT +2.7%) agrees to acquire select assets of CarterEnergy, including the assets comprising the company's wholesale motor fuel distribution business. Financial terms are not disclosed, but the transaction is expected to be $0.04-$0.07 accretive to earnings on a GAAP basis in the first 12 months.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • CTSH

    Cognizant (CTSH +12.2%) soars after beating Q2 EPS estimates. The IT outsourcing firm expects Q3...

    Cognizant (CTSH +12.2%) soars after beating Q2 EPS estimates. The IT outsourcing firm expects Q3 revenue of at least $1.875B and EPS of $0.92 vs. a consensus of $1.88B and $0.86. Full-year guidance is for revenue of at least $7.34B and EPS of at least $3.38 vs. a consensus of $7.34B and $3.37. Cognizant's strong performance in North America (+24% Y/Y in Q2) is offsetting slower European growth (+6%). Up in sympathy: INFY +2.1%. WIT +1.5%. ACN +1.6%. EPAM +3.1%.
